doc.after: In 1081 William I, King of England, began work on the castle keep within the walls of the old Roman fort.[29] Cardiff Castle has been at the heart of the city ever since.[30] The castle was substantially altered and extended during the Victorian period by John Crichton-Stuart, 3rd Marquess of Bute, and the architect William Burges. Original Roman work can, however, still be distinguished in the wall facings.
